p.span:
Montesano is a community where people learn,
grow and work together. With high-quality
instruction, every student, regardless of race, class,
language, or disability, can succeed.

div.p: Athletics - Continuous Learning - Events - Grades and Next Year - Internet and Technology Capabilities - Lockers/Belongings - Money/Fees - Parent/Guardian - Running Start - Seniors

div.h3: + What happens with summer sports? Football camp? Weights?

hr.p: As soon as the “Stay Home/Stay Healthy” order has been lifted, decisions will be made about summer sports, football camp, and summer weights. Some of these events may be canceled or postponed in accordance with the Governor’s orders.

div.h3: + Are we going to have online classes?

ul.li: As directed by OSPI, our goal is to ensure student learning continues during the school closure. Our continuous learning plan will officially begin the week of April 20th; however, many of our teachers have already reached out and started online learning with students. Our model for remote learning is teacher-facilitated learning with a focus on critical standards and flexibility. All lessons and activities provided will be based on our current curriculum in order to ensure student preparation for the next grade level.

Please know that we recognize that elementary students and secondary students have different levels of independence, and some students may require more support to be successful. We also understand some parents may have limited availability and resources to assist their child(ren).

hr.h3: + How will students be prepared for the next grade? What is the effect that this will have on learning and advancement?

ul.li: Montesano School District staff are working to ensure that students will be prepared for the next grade starting fall of 2020. In grades K-8, teachers are focusing on major standards. Staff are reflecting on standards that were covered prior to the closure and will be presenting learning opportunities to introduce standards that still need to be taught. Additionally, staff are creating plans to review any standards in the fall of 2020 to make sure the learning gap is narrow. In grades 9-12, staff are monitoring student performance and paying careful attention to ensure students do not get behind on credits. Staff are presenting students with activities such as project-based learning opportunities to reinforce core standards. Completion of the projects and activities can only improve a student’s grade.
Statewide, teachers will be assessing students and making adjustments to the curriculum in the fall to ensure students meet core standards in all subject areas

hr.h3: + Are you going to try to partner with an online service? It’s really confusing to get 5 or more suggested websites. Having zoom is great, but even better when a video can be viewed at a later time in case it was missed? Or at least have a daily/weekly mapped out plan for kids and parents to try and follow along so we can help keep our kids on task as best as possible?

hr.p: At this time, teachers are using Google Classroom, Zoom, and Skyward to post activities and to connect with students and their families. Our teachers understand schedules may work for some and others may need more flexibility or accessibility to lessons at a different time. Staff will be communicating often with students and their families to ensure everyone has access to the continued learning opportunities and to make adjustments as needed.
hr.h3: + What about the special education students? services like speech and OT? 504?

hr.p: All students are general education students first, so please review all information related to the district’s continuous learning plans. Individual education plans (IEPs) and 504s (ie., accommodations and modifications) are developed and implemented in the context of the general education environment. The general education environment has obviously shifted. All of our students will be engaging in the learning process in a different way. IEP teams (parents/guardians are part of the team) will work together to determine what support and programming are appropriate on a case-by-case basis. These decisions will be made in the context of general education and the individual needs of the student. We are working hard to be sensitive to family needs, family and student cultures, language differences, and strengths. Just like general education, special education and 504 accommodations will continue. We will all need to work together to determine what that looks like for each child on a case-by-case basis.
hr.h3: + Will the school be offering summer school?

hr.p: Montesano Jr/Sr High will continue to hold summer school for credit retrieval. Students who were behind in credit or failing a class prior to the school closure, will be given the opportunity to make up that credit through an APEX online course. Students in good standing before the closure,will be given opportunities to grow, but their grades will not be in jeopardy due to Covid-19.
hr.h3: + Can you send out digital packets instead of having to pick them up at school?

hr.p: Yes. Digital packets can be mailed or delivered to homes. Get a hold of your child’s teacher and/or principal to make a request.
hr.h3: + Is there availability for chrome books for students?

hr.p: Yes. All three schools are checking out Chromebooks to families in need. Send an email to your child’s principal.

ul.li: Jr/Sr High: agreene@monteschools.org or apugh@monteschools.org Principals are available at the schools, Monday-Friday, 9-11AM to check out Chromebooks.

div.h3: + Is there any info on the rescheduling of school events?

hr.p: As soon as the “Stay Home/Stay Healthy” order has been lifted, decisions will be made about school events. Some of these events may be canceled or postponed in accordance with the Governor’s orders.
The answers are being developed, and will be posted ASAP

div.h3: + Can we get a device for school work?

hr.p: Yes. All three schools are checking out Chromebooks to families in need. Send an email to your child’s principal

ul.li: Jr/Sr High: agreene@monteschools.org or apugh@monteschools.org Principals are available at the schools, Monday-Friday, 9-11AM to check out Chromebooks.

hr.p: Please see our Zoom information page.

div.h3: + When will students be able to get their belongings from their lockers?

hr.p: After the “Stay Home, Stay Healthy” order is lifted, school principals will provide a schedule that will allow students an opportunity to come into school, clean out lockers, and return books. This will also include PE lockers for the Jr./Sr. High School.
hr.h3: + How do we get textbooks that we need for online work?

hr.p: Principals are at the schools, 9-11AM daily and can distribute textbooks as needed
If your child needs his/her instrument, please contact your child’s principal to arrange pick up, Monday-Friday, 9-11AM.
After the stay at home order is lifted, we will have a scheduled time for students to clean out their PE lockers.
hr.h3: + We ordered volleyball pictures and are wondering if the photographer is shipping them?

hr.p: Parents can email agreene@monteschools.org or apugh@monteschools.org, and we can set up a time for you to pick up athletic pictures.
hr.h3: + Will the students still have a yearbook? What if we had pre ordered a yearbook, will we still be getting them?

hr.p: Once yearbooks have arrived and the “Stay Home, Stay Healthy” order is lifted, there will be a schedule for students to pick up yearbooks.

div.h3: + I have placed a sum into my child’s lunch account. Can I have a refund?

ul.li: Yes. We are happy to process a refund. Please contact Sheila Baker at sbaker@monteschools.org or 360-249-1235. Please provide your name, your child’s name, and a current address for the refund check to be mailed.
All balances on food service accounts will be carried over to the 20-21 school year, unless a request for a refund is made.

hr.h3: + How do I return my gym keys to get my deposit back how should I do this?

hr.p: If you were issued gym keys, please drop them off at one of the schools between 9:00 and 11:00AM, Monday through Friday, and a refund will be processed.
hr.h3: + We have a volleyball uniform top to return to the school and are wondering how we go about doing that.

hr.p: You are welcome to drop the uniform off to the principal(s) anytime between 9:00 and 11:00AM daily. We would be happy to receive the uniform and get it back to the coach.
hr.h3: + I have library books checked out, I am worried about overdue fines. How do I return them.

hr.p: Library books may be dropped off at the schools between 9:00-11:00AM and principals will get the books where they need to go. However, please note we will not be fining students for turning a library book in at a later time.
hr.h3: + We bought a cap and gown, and I was wondering if there isn't graduation will we get refunds?

hr.p: The school does not handle the refunds for the caps and gowns. Herff Jones will be delivering caps and gowns April 22nd. Senior advisors are coming up with a plan to hand out senior graduation orders (cap & gown, etc.) and will be posting the schedule for pick-up on the Senior Google Classroom page and social media. The school district is still planning on having some sort of graduation ceremony for our seniors in which gap and gowns will be required.
The answers are being developed, and will be posted ASAP

div.h3: + How does running start work now?

ul.li: Running Start does not change. If you are currently enrolled at the college and taking classes for the spring quarter, you will need to stay in good standing in those courses. For students who are thinking about Running Start for next year, they should contact their counselor to receive instructions on how to proceed.
If you are planning to drop or have dropped your class at the college, be sure to contact Mr. Pace and/or Mrs. Herzog as soon as possible.

hr.p: If a student was on track to graduate at the time we left school on the 13th of March and are currently passing their classes, they will graduate with the class of 2020 from Montesano. Although we have not worked out the particulars, we are planning to have a graduation ceremony for our students. Obviously some of these decisions are beyond our control, but as more direction from the state is released, we will make more plans for our graduates.
hr.h3: + Are we planning on having a graduation ceremony?

hr.p: The class of 2020 will have a graduation ceremony. The logistics of the ceremony will be decided once the Governor lifts the “Stay Home, Stay Healthy” order.
hr.h3: + Do seniors need to complete project me still?

hr.p: The district is waiving the portions of Project Me that do not fall under state guidelines. If students have not completed some portions that fall under state guidelines, then they will have to complete those portions (ie. High School and Beyond Plan). The presentation and job shadow portions are district requirements and will be waived through school board action.
hr.h3: + Do the Seniors need to finish any school work in order to graduate?

hr.p: If a senior was passing at the time school was released in March, and he/she is considered to be in good standing, he/she will graduate on time with the class. For students who were not passing, they have and will be given opportunities to get all their classes to passing grades. Any student who participates in the learning being offered from now until the end of the year will have the ability to improve their standing in classes. We highly encourage all students, even the seniors, to continue to be engaged in the learning offered at Montesano.
